perturbation.original_text: 5.3     THE  NETTAXI  SERVICES  FURNISHED  AS  A  RESULT  OF  OR UNDER THIS AGREEMENT  ARE  PROVIDED  ON  AN  "AS  IS"  BASIS,  WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTIES  OR REPRESENTATIONS  EXPRESS,  IMPLIED  OR STATUTORY; INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, WARRANTIES  OF QUALITY, PERFORMANCE, NONINFRINGEMENT, MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR  A  PARTICULAR  PURPOSE. NOR ARE THERE ANY WARRANTIES CREATED BY A COURSE OF DEALING,  COURSE  OF  PERFORMANCE OR TRADE USAGE. NETTAXI  DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES, WILL MEET SPINRECORDS.COM'S OR ANY END USERS NEEDS OR BE FREE FROM ERRORS,  OR  THAT  THE  OPERATION  OF  ITS  WEB PAGES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED. THE FOREGOING  EXCLUSIONS  AND  DISCLAIMERS ARE AN ESSENTIAL PART OF THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3     THE  NETTAXI  SERVICES  FURNISHED  AS  A  RESULT  OF  OR UNDER THIS AGREEMENT  ARE  PROVIDED  ON  AN  "AS  IS"  BASIS,  WITHOUT  ANY  REPRESENTATIONS  EXPRESS. NETTAXI  DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES, WILL MEET SPINRECORDS.COM'S OR ANY END USERS NEEDS OR BE FREE FROM ERRORS,  OR  THAT  THE  OPERATION  OF  ITS  WEB PAGES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED. THE FOREGOING  EXCLUSIONS  AND  DISCLAIMERS ARE AN ESSENTIAL PART OF THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the disclaimer of implied warranties, specifically MERCHANTABILITY and FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, the agreement creates a legal contradiction. California law implies these warranties in many commercial transactions, and removing the explicit disclaimer may leave NETTAXI exposed to liabilities they sought to avoid. Deleting the "STATUTORY" portion of the original agreement increases this effect, since it limits NETTAXI from protecting themselves from implied, statutory warranty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code ยง2314 and ยง2315 (Implied Warranty of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose)

perturbation.original_text:
8.2     Convenience.  NETTAXI  may terminate this Agreement at any time for
---------- its  convenience,  for  no  reason or for any reason, upon sixty (60) days prior written  notice  to  SpinRecords.com.  In  the  event  of  such  termination, Spinrecords.com  shall  be  entitled  to receive and retain all payments made or payable  by  NETTAXI  prior  to  the  date  of  termination. SpinRecords.com may terminate  this  Agreement  for no reason or for any reason upon sixty (60) days prior  written  notice  to  NETTAXI.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.2     Convenience.  NETTAXI  may terminate this Agreement at any time for
---------- its  convenience,  for  no  reason or for any reason, upon sixty (60) days prior written  notice  to  SpinRecords.com.  In  the  event  of  such  termination, Spinrecords.com  shall  be  entitled  to receive and retain all payments made or payable  by  NETTAXI  prior  to  the  date  of  termination. SpinRecords.com may terminate  this  Agreement  upon sixty (60) days prior  written  notice  to  NETTAXI.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "for no reason or for any reason" from SpinRecords.com's termination clause, the agreement implies that SpinRecords.com requires a valid reason to terminate. This creates a legal contradiction because California law generally allows parties to terminate contracts at will, unless explicitly restricted by the contract. This now restricts SpinRecords.com rights of 'at will termination'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code Section 1657 'If time is not stated, a reasonable time is allowed.'

perturbation.original_text:
9.7     Assignment.  Neither  NETTAXI  or  SpinRecords.com shall assign its
---------- respective  rights  or delegate its obligations hereunder, either in whole or in part,  whether  by  operation  of  law  or  otherwise, without the prior written consent  of  the other party. Any attempted assignment or delegation without the other  party's  written  consent  will  be  void.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.7     Assignment.  Neither  NETTAXI  or  SpinRecords.com shall assign its
---------- respective  rights  or delegate its obligations hereunder, either in whole or in part,  without the prior written consent  of  the other party. Any attempted assignment or delegation without the other  party's  written  consent  will  be  void.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "whether by operation of law or otherwise", this clause now allows implied assignment. The assignment clause now only prohibits the respective rights or delegates its obligations, either in whole or in part. By removing the text the contract doesn't explicitly address transfers, a common law provision, which are outside the parties' direct control. This omission creates a legal risk by potentially exposing SpinRecords.com or NETTAXI to unintended assignments, conflicting with legal default rules regarding assignment by operation of law. This could lead to disputes and complications with successor entities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California law regarding assignment by operation of law (e.g., in cases of merger or acquisition)
